info.description:
Testing The production Management API is a secure REST API that provides read/write access to your Kentico Kontent projects. # Introduction Use the API to migrate your existing content into your Kentico Kontent project, or update content in unpublished content items. The API cannot be used on published content unless you create new versions of the content items first, either in UI or through the Management API. When retrieving and updating content via the Management API, you always work with the latest versions of content – the same as you would see in the Kentico Kontent user interface. Learn how to import content via the API by taking the tutorial on [Importing to Kentico Kontent](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/import_to_kontent). The base URL for all requests is `https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/`. All requests to the API must be made securely with HTTPS with [TLS 1.2](https://github.com/Kentico/delivery-sdk-net/wiki/Fixing-error:-Could-not-create-SSL-TLS-secure-channel "A note on TLS 1.1 deprecation") and [authenticated](#section/Authentication) with a valid API key. Requests to the API are [rate limited](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/rate_limiting_a8989eb) and uncached.

API requests limits

The requests made to the Management API count towards the overall API calls limit set in our Fair Use Policy. For more information, see Pricing FAQ on our Kentico Kontent website.

``` curl --request GET \ --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects//items \ --header 'Authorization: Bearer ' \ --header 'Content-type: application/json' ``` The Management API does not provide any content filtering options and is not optimized for content delivery. If you need to deliver larger amounts of content, filter it, and leverage content caching, we recommend using the [Delivery API](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/delivery_api) instead. # Authentication To work with the Management API, send your requests over HTTPS and authenticate using the `Authorization` header in the following format: `Authorization: Bearer `. To get your API key for the Management API, go to [Kentico Kontent](https://app.kontent.ai/) > Project settings > API keys. The API key provides access to a single Kentico Kontent project. You will need different API keys for each of your projects. # SDK We offer a [.NET SDK](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/develop_apps__net) to help you work with the API. However, no SDK is required to use the API. # Guidelines on handling changes The state of the Management API may change in the future, however, the majority won't be breaking changes. To help you create more robust scripts and integrations, we've prepared a list of general changes to the API that we don't consider breaking. We recommend you read through the list to ensure you don't rely on a state that might change in the future. In general, the non-breaking changes include adding functionality or changes in order of the returned data. More specifically, the following are NOT breaking changes: * General: * Add a new endpoint. * Change the API behavior to fix a bug in the service. * Change rate limitation. * Change error message text. * Responses: * Add a new property to JSON objects. * Change the order of JSON object properties. * Add a new type of element for content types or snippets. * Add a new HTML element to [rich text elements](#section/Rich-text-element). * Add a new attribute to HTML element in rich text elements. * Add a new value to HTML element attribute in rich text elements. * Change the order of HTML element attributes in rich text elements. * Represent some characters as HTML entities. * Add a new response header. * Add a body to a request that contained none. * Requests: * Add a new optional property to JSON objects. * Add a new optional attribute to HTML element in rich text elements. * Add a new value to the HTML element attribute in rich text elements. * Add a new optional request header. * Add a new optional query string parameter. * Add an optional body to request that contained none. # Errors The Management API returns standard HTTP status codes to indicate success or failure of a request. In general, status codes in the `2xx` range indicate a successful request, status codes in the `4xx` range indicate errors caused by an incorrect input (for example, providing incorrect API key), and status codes in the `5xx` range indicate an error on our side. ## HTTP status codes summary
**HTTP status code** **Description**
`400` **Bad request** The request was not understood. Check your request for missing required parameters or invalid query parameter values.
`401` **Unauthorized** The provided API key is invalid or missing.
`403` **Forbidden** The provided API key is invalid for the requested project.
`404` **Not found** The requested resource doesn't exist. Try checking the path for typos.
`405` **Method not allowed** The requested HTTP method is not supported for the specified resource. Try performing a GET request.
`409` **Conflict** The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the specified resource. For example, this may occur if a resource is modified via multiple requests at the same time.
`429` **Too many requests** The [rate limit](#tag/Rate-limiting) for the API has been exceeded. Try your request again after a few seconds.
`5xx` **Internal Error** or **Service Unavailable** Something went wrong on our side. Try your request again after a few seconds and use a retry policy.
## Resolving errors For troubleshooting failed requests, the API provides error messages defined in a consumable format to help you identify and fix the issue. If you cannot identify and resolve an issue with your API call, you can contact us with the response status and the request ID you get in the error response.
info.title: Management API v1

post.description:
Create a new content item based on a specific content type. Content items do NOT contain any content themselves, but serve as wrappers for individual language variants.

To import content to a specific [language variant](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/language_variants_bbc6039) of a content item, you can [upsert a language variant](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/upsert_a_language_variant_0e7d242).

If you are importing content from a different system and want to use the same identifiers for your content as in the previous system, use the `external_id` property to set a custom identifier for the new content item.

requestBody.description: The content item to be added.

400.description: The specified request body is invalid.

example.message: Provide ID of content item's content type.

get.description: Retrieve a dynamically paginated list of content items.

200.description: A dynamically paginated list of content items.

400.description: The specified continuation token is invalid.

example.message: Query parameter 'continuationToken' is invalid. Please include the valid token specified in the pagination response.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: application/json'

get.description:
Retrieve metadata about a content item.

If you want to retrieve content data, see how to [retrieve language variants of a content item](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/list_variants_of_an_item_1380d97).

404.description: The specified content item was not found.

example.message: The requested content item '59713' was not found.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474 \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/codename/my_article \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/external-id/59713 \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: application/json'

put.description:
Update an existing content item or add a new content item specified by its external ID.

You can also specify the external ID when [adding content items](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/add_a_content_item_e59ba3c).

requestBody.description: The content item to update or create.

200.description: The the specified content item was updated.

201.description: The specified content item was created.

400.description: The provided request body is invalid.

example.message: The provided request body is invalid. See the 'validation_errors' attribute for more information and specify a valid JSON object.

validation_errors.message: Required property 'type' was not found or is set to null.

delete.description: Deleting a content item also deletes all of its language variants. If you only want to delete a specific language variant, see how to [delete a language variant](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/delete_a_language_variant_c809f52).

204.description: The specified content item was deleted from the project.

404.description: The specified content item was already deleted or doesn't exist.

example.message: The requested content item 'f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474' was not found.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request DELETE \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474 \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474/items/codename/my_article \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/external-id/59713 \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: application/json'

get.description:
Retrieve a list of language variants of a content item.

If the variant contains both a published and draft version, the API will return the draft version since the draft is considered as the latest version.

If you want to retrieve metadata information about the parent content item, see how to [retrieve a content item](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/retrieve_a_content_item_c02594a).
get.summary: List language variants of an item

200.description: Array of language variants for the specified content item.

404.description: The specified content item was not found.

example.message: The requested content item '4db9f4da-827b-4400-87c9-c47d44fba65d' was not found.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/projects/v1/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474/variants \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/projects/v1/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/codename/my_article/variants \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/projects/v1/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/external-id/59713/variants \ 
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: application/json'

get.description:
Retrieve content of a language variant of a content item.

If the variant contains both a published and draft version, the API will return the draft version since the draft is considered as the latest version.

If you want to retrieve metadata about the content item, see how to [retrieve a content item](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/retrieve_a_content_item_c02594a).

200.description: Language variant for the specified language and content item.

404.description: The specified language variant was not found.

example.message: The requested content item 'getting_contents' was not found.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request GET \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474/variants/d1f95fde-af02-b3b5-bd9e-f232311ccab8 \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474/variants/codename/es-ES \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/codename/my_article/variants/d1f95fde-af02-b3b5-bd9e-f232311ccab8 \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/codename/my_article/variants/codename/es-ES \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/external-id/59713/variants/d1f95fde-af02-b3b5-bd9e-f232311ccab8 \
# --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/items/external-id/59713/variants/codename/es-ES \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: application/json'

put.description:
Add content to a language variant in an active language, or update an existing language variant. If you're creating a new language variant, a content item for the variant must exist. It doesn't get created automatically.

Updating content of elements

  • Only the elements specified in the request body will be modified.
  • Any comments attached to the specified elements will be lost on update.
When copying variants in an [environment](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/manage_environments), you can take the variant object returned by the [GET request](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/retrieve_a_language_variant_850b2bf) and use the object as-is in the body of this request. To migrate variants to another environment or project, see how to [import content items](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/import_content_items).

elements.title: En Asados
elements.summary: Tostar granos de café puede tardar de 6 a 13 minutos. ...
elements.meta_description: Tostar granos de café puede tardar de 6 a 13 minutos. ...

requestBody.description: Specifies which [elements](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/elements_in_language_variants_36574f3) to update. Each element is represented as a key-value pair. Depending on the element type, the element values can be strings, numbers, or arrays of [Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) objects.

200.description: The specified language variant was updated.

elements.title: En Asados
elements.summary: Tostar granos de café puede tardar de 6 a 13 minutos. Diferentes tiempos de asado producen diferentes tipos de café, con diferentes concentraciones de cafeína y intensidad de sabor.
elements.meta_description: Tostar granos de café puede tardar de 6 a 13 minutos. Diferentes tiempos de asado producen diferentes tipos de café, con diferentes concentraciones de cafeína y intensidad de sabor.

201.description: The specified language variant was created.

elements.meta_description: Tostar granos de café puede tardar de 6 a 13 minutos. Diferentes tiempos de asado producen diferentes tipos de café, con diferentes concentraciones de cafeína y intensidad de sabor.

400.description: The provided request body does not match the content type.

example.message: The provided request body is invalid. See the 'validation_errors' attribute for more information and specify a valid JSON object.

validation_errors.message: Value '2014-13-07T00:00:00Z' cannot be assigned to an element of 'DateTime' type.

404.description: The specified language variant does not exist.

example.message: The requested content item 'getting_contents' was not found.

delete.description:
Deletes a specific language variant. If you want to delete all language variants of a content item, see how to [Delete a content item](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/delete_a_content_item_051a7c0).

When you delete the last variant of a content item, the whole content item is deleted.

204.description: The specified language variant was deleted.

404.description: The specified language variant was not found.

example.message: The requested content item variant was not found.

post.description:
Add a new file. The uploaded file will not be visible in the Kentico Kontent UI unless you [add an asset](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/add_an_asset_a7cf801) using it.

Adding assets is a 2-step process

  1. Upload a binary file – after uploading, you get a file reference to uploaded file.
  2. Create a new asset – use the file reference to link the new asset with the file.

Maximum size limit for binary files is 100 MB.

requestBody.description: The binary data of the file.

200.description: A file reference to the uploaded binary file.

400.description: The specified request body or the provided parameters are invalid.

example.message: The request does not contain required header Content-Type.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/files/which-brewing-fits-you-1080px.jpg \
  --data-binary "@which-brewing-fits-you-1080px.jpg" \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: image/jpeg' \
  --header 'Content-length: 125770'

post.description:
Use a file reference to link an existing [binary file](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/upload_a_binary_file_50fcad8) to a new asset. You can also create assets by upserting (PUT `/assets/external-id/`).

Each binary file can be referenced only by a single asset.

title.description: The title of the new asset. Use this parameter to better identify and filter your assets in the UI.

external_id.description:
The external ID of the new asset. Use this parameter as a unique identifier for your assets.

You cannot upsert external ID into already existing assets within your Kentico Kontent project.

example.title: Description of what the file contains

descriptions.description: The asset's alt text in the default language describing what the file or image shows.

example.title: Description of what the file contains

descriptions.description: The asset's alt text in the default language describing what the file or image shows.

example.message: The provided request body is invalid. See the 'validation_errors' attribute for more information and specify a valid JSON object.

validation_errors.message: Required property 'description' not found in JSON. Path 'descriptions[0]', line 7, position 6.

post.description:
Checks your project's content items for issues, such as:
* Content elements [referencing](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) non-existing objects.
* Values of content elements not meeting the limitations configured in content types.
* Content types referencing non-existing taxonomy groups.

We recommend that you use this endpoint after successfully importing content into your project.

200.description: A project report summarizing the issues found in the specified project.

x-codeSamples.source:
curl --request POST \
  --url https://manage.kontent.ai/v1/projects/<YOUR_PROJECT_ID>/validate \
  --header 'Authorization: Bearer <YOUR_API_KEY>' \
  --header 'Content-type: application/json'

tags.description:
By default, the API keys for the Management API are **valid for 4,000 days**. The scope of the API keys is **per project per user**. This means you need a separate API key for each of your projects. The API key inherits the identity of the user who generated it. Operations performed with the key will show in [your version history](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/comparing_and_restoring_versions) as changes made by the specific user. If you regenerate the API key before its expiration date, the system will revoke the previous API key after a short while. For requests made with a revoked API key, you'll receive the `403 Unauthorized` error response. ```json { "request_id": "800000c0-0001-fc00-b63f-84710c7967bb", "error_code": 7, "message": "The provided API key was revoked. You can find a valid API key for this project in the Kentico Kontent app." } ```

Friendly reminder

5 days before the API key expires, we will send a notification email to users with the Manage APIs permission.
tags.name: API key scope and validity

tags.description:
Rate limits specify the number of requests you or your application can make to the Management API within a specific time window. There are two separate time windows, second and minute, allowing a different number of requests each. By default, the Management API enforces the following rate limits: * **10** requests per second * **400** requests per minute These [limits apply to each API key](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/api_key_scope_and_validity_0322d9c) for the Management API.

Avoid parallel requests

We strongly advise against making multiple requests to the API in parallel. Doing so may cause unpredictable behavior and lead to inconsistencies in your content. We recommend that you wait for each request to finish before sending another one.

When you reach the limit of a specific time window, the API will reject the request and respond with the [429 HTTP error](https://httpstatuses.com/429 "Too Many Requests"). ```json { "request_id": "80000004-0002-fd00-b63f-84710c7967bb", "error_code": 10000, "message": "API rate limit exceeded. Please retry your request later." } ``` The error response will include the [`Retry-After` header](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Headers/Retry-After) that tells you how many *seconds* you need to wait before attempting further requests. Each failed request is perfectly safe to retry. If you begin to receive [429 HTTP errors](https://httpstatuses.com/429 "Too Many Requests"), reduce the frequency of your requests.
tags.name: Rate limiting

tags.description:
References identify objects within your project. For example, you can use references to specify content types, content items, languages, and more. When specifying references to objects, the object can be identified by **one** of three properties: 1. Its internal ID, such as `18b43cc5-f4fd-0172-842b-3ae2c878cf6f` * Generated by the system automatically. * Unique per object type such as content item, content type, and other. * Can be used to specify any object. 2. Its codename, such as `object_codename` * Initially [generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the object's display name. * Unique per object type such as content item, content type, and other. * Can be used to specify most objects. 3. Its external ID, such as `custom-object-identifier` * Specified manually when creating the object through the Management API. The external ID cannot be changed later. * Unique per object type and its subtype such as content type and its content elements, or multiple choice element and its options. * Can be used to specify user-created assets, content items, content types, content groups, elements, languages, taxonomy groups, and taxonomy terms. ### Rules for codenames When editing codenames, the new codenames must meet the following conditions: * Only lowercase letters, numbers, and underscores are permitted. * Codenames must start with a letter or an underscore and have at least one character. * Codenames are usually limited to 60 characters, but longer codenames are allowed for multiple choice options and taxonomy terms. * Codenames of elements within a snippet must be prefixed with the snippet's codename. * Codenames must be unique per object type. This applies to, for example, every element within a content type, every content type within a project, every content item within a project, and so on. This means the following applies when codenames are generated automatically: * All letters are made lowercase. * All forbidden characters are replaced by `_`. * For any names that start with a number, the codename will start with `n`. * Codenames that duplicate another codename will have a random string attached to the end. * Codenames of elements within a snippet will be prefixed with the snippet's codename. * Codenames will be cut off at the character limit. ## Reference object The API uses internal IDs for referencing objects. This means that the reference objects in the API responses will always use internal IDs. ## External IDs for imported content By using external IDs to reference other objects in your project, you can import your content in the order you prefer. For example, when importing multiple articles that contain images, you can reference these images with external IDs, such as `roaster` or `coffee-cup`, before uploading them. The referenced images will be visible in the UI only after you [add them as assets](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/add_an_asset_a7cf801) via the Management API. With this approach, you can choose whether you want to create content items first and then upload binary files for assets, or vice versa. This means you can use external IDs to reference objects that don't yet exist in the project and add the objects via the API later. References to non-existent objects will be stored and retrieved via the Management API as internal IDs. To check whether your project contains any references to not-yet-created objects, see how to [validate project content](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/validate_project_content_c0e22b2).

Referencing objects that are not in your project yet

The Management API supports referencing of non-existent objects in the following elements:

  • Linked items element
  • Asset element
  • Rich text element (as assets, content items, and links)

To learn more, see how to import linked content to your project.

### Missing objects in the UI If you use external IDs to reference non-existent objects in your elements, the referenced objects won't be shown in the UI. This is because the system cannot find those objects. The referenced assets and content items will be displayed after you create them with their specific external IDs via the Management API. To add the missing objects, see: * [Upsert a content item](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/upsert_a_content_item_cc755ac) to create content items specified by external IDs. * [Upsert an asset](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/upsert_an_asset_0982745) to create assets specified by external IDs.
tags.name: References

tags.description:
To manage content items via the Management API, you need to send requests to URIs based on the following patterns:
* Using internal IDs: `<base_URL>/items/<content_item_id>`
* Using codenames: `<base_URL>/items/codename/<content_item_codename>`
* Using external IDs: `<base_URL>/items/external-id/<content_item_external_identifier>`

To [retrieve language variants](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/list_variants_of_an_item_1380d97) of a specific content item, you can list the variants by specifying the internal ID, codename, or external ID of the content item.

## Content item object


The content item object contains metadata about your content, such as the name of the content item and when the item was last modified. The content item object does not store the content itself. The content for each language variant of a content item is saved in [language variants](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/language_variants_bbc6039), with each content item having as many variants as there are active languages in your project.

<SchemaDefinition schemaRef="#/components/schemas/ContentItem" showReadOnly={true} showWriteOnly={true} />
tags.name: Content items

tags.description:
When you retrieve or update [language variants](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/language_variants_bbc6039), you will work with a set of elements. The set contains the elements as defined in the content type. The elements come in the form of key-value pairs and contain only information about their values, not their type.

About element identifiers

In API responses, the Management API will always reference content elements with their internal IDs. When creating or updating language variants via the API, you can reference content elements by their internal IDs or codenames.

## Asset element The value of asset elements is an array of [Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) objects. Each object represents a single asset, which can be referenced only once. When retrieving asset elements, the Management API will always reference assets with their internal IDs. When updating asset elements, you can reference assets by their internal ID or external ID. ## Custom element ## Date and time element ## Linked items element The value of linked items elements is an array of [Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) objects. Each reference represents a single content item. Every content item can be referenced only once. When retrieving linked items elements, the Management API will always reference content items with their internal IDs. When updating linked items elements, you can reference a content item by its internal ID, codename, or external ID. ## Multiple choice element The value of *Multiple choice* elements is an array of [Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) objects. Each reference represents one of the unique multiple choice options. If the element is configured as single option (i.e., Radio buttons), it must contain a reference to exactly one option. When configured as multiple option (i.e., Checkboxes), the element can contain references to as many options as are defined in the content type. In case no option is selected, the value of the element will be an empty array. When retrieving *Multiple choice* elements, the Management API will always reference the multiple choice options with their internal IDs. When updating *Multiple choice* elements, you can reference an option by its internal ID or codename. ## Number element ## Rich text element ### HTML5 elements allowed in rich text The rich text value can contain specific HTML elements, tags, and attributes, and must form a valid HTML5 fragment. Only the documented HTML attributes are supported. When transforming HTML to JSON, make sure to escape all double quotes.
**Types** **HTML elements** **Notes**
Paragraphs <p>...</p> Must be used at the top level.
Headings <h1>...</h1>, <h2>...</h2>, <h3>...</h3>, <h4>...</h4> Must be used at the top level.
Bold text <strong>...</strong> Must be nested. The <b> tag is not supported.
Italic text <em>...</em> Must be nested. The <i> tag is not supported.
Superscript <sup>...</sup> Must be nested. Superscript and subscript are mutually exclusive.
Subscript <sub>...</sub> Must be nested. Superscript and subscript are mutually exclusive.
Code <code>...</code> Must be nested.
[Lists](#section/Rich-text-element/lists-in-rich-text) <ol><li>...</li></ol>, <ul><li>...</li></ul> Must be nested.
[Tables](#section/Rich-text-element/tables-in-rich-text) <table><tbody><tr><td>...</td></tr></tbody></table> Must be used at the top level. The <thead> and <tfoot> tags are not supported.
[Links](#section/Rich-text-element/links-in-rich-text) <a ...>...</a> Can be used at the top level and be nested. Not all <a> attributes are supported.
[Assets](#section/Rich-text-element/assets-in-rich-text) <figure ...><img ...></figure> Must be used at the top level.
[Content items](#section/Rich-text-element/content-items-in-rich-text) <object ...></object> Must be used at the top level.
Line breaks <br/>
### Assets in Rich text Assets in rich text are defined by the block element `
tags.name: Elements in language variants

tags.description:
Language variants represent a localized variant of a content item. For example, when your project contains 2 active languages, each content item in that project can have 2 language variants.

Deactivated languages

If a language is deactivated in the project settings, the respective language variants cannot be retrieved via the Management API. In such cases, the API will return a 404 not found error.

Every language variant is generally tied to a specific [content item](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/content_items_01eeb10) and project [language](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/languages). This means you need to specify a language identifier when you request the variant, even if your project contains only one language. To manage language variants via the Management API, send requests to URLs based on the following patterns: * Item ID + Language ID: `/items//variants/` * Item ID + Language codename: `/items//variants/codename/` * Item codename + Language ID: `/items/codename//variants/` * Item codename + Language codename: `/items/codename//variants/codename/` * Item external ID + Language ID: `/items/external-id//variants/` * Item external ID + Language codename: `/items/external-id//variants/codename/` These endpoints accept GET, PUT, and DELETE requests, allowing you to retrieve, upsert, and delete language variants. You can mix and match the identifiers of content items and languages when requesting language variants. ## Language variant object When copying or migrating language variants, you can take the language variant object returned [when retrieving a language variant](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/retrieve_a_language_variant_850b2bf) and use it without modification in the body of a [request to upsert a language variant](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/upsert_a_language_variant_0e7d242).
tags.name: Language variants

tags.description:
Assets in Kentico Kontent consist of a reference to a binary file and metadata describing the file. Each binary file can be referenced only by a single asset. Once an asset is created, the file it references cannot be changed, you can only modify the asset's descriptions and title.

Adding assets is a 2-step process

  1. Upload a binary file – after uploading, you get a file reference to uploaded file.
  2. Create a new asset – use the file reference to link the new asset with the file.

Binary files that are not used by any assets will not be visible in the Kentico Kontent UI.

## Asset object
tags.name: Assets

tags.description:
## Project information object


The project information object contains basic information about your project, i.e., the project ID and display name. By calling the [Retrieve project information](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/retrieve_project_information_8ae1003) endpoint, you can also validate your [Management API key](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/api_key_scope_and_validity_0322d9c).

<SchemaDefinition schemaRef="#/components/schemas/Project" showReadOnly={true} showWriteOnly={true} />
tags.name: Project information

tags.description:
After importing your content in Kentico Kontent, you can [validate the whole project](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/validate_project_content) to find out whether there are any issues within the imported content.

## Project report object


A project validity report contains a list of issues found in language variants of call content items. The issues can indicate that either certain elements reference non-existing objects or contain values that do not meet the limitations set by a content type.

<SchemaDefinition schemaRef="#/components/schemas/ProjectReport" showReadOnly={true} showWriteOnly={true} /> 

## Element issue object


For each issue found in a specific language variant, the `issues` array will contain an element issue with metadata about the element and a list of validation messages describing the problem.

A note on terminology in messages: A "content module" is a content item referenced in *Linked items* or *Rich text* elements. See [Linked content and components](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/linked_content_and_components) for more details.

<SchemaDefinition schemaRef="#/components/schemas/ElementIssue" showReadOnly={true} showWriteOnly={true} />
tags.name: Project validation

item_identifier_dc3e32b.description: Identifies a content item by its internal ID (e.g., `335d17ac-b6ba-4c6a-ae31-23c1193215cb`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/custom-identifier-for-my-article`), or codename (e.g., `codename/my_article`).
item_identifier_dc3e32b.name: item_identifier

continuationtoken.description:
Determines the page of results to retrieve.

To get the next page, see the pagination object in the response and set the `continuationToken` parameter to the value of the `continuation_token` property.
continuationtoken.name: continuationToken

item_identifier_for_upsert_bf1e709.description:
Identifies a content item by its internal ID (e.g., `f4b3fc05-e988-4dae-9ac1-a94aba566474`), external ID (e.g., `external-id/59713`), or codename (e.g., `codename/on_roasts `). * When creating a new content item, use an [external ID](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) as the item's identifier. * When updating an existing content item, identify the item by its codename, [external ID](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9), or internal ID.

External IDs

If the specified external ID is not used by an existing content item, the API will create a new item. If the content item specified by the external ID already exists, the properties specified in the request body will be updated.
item_identifier_for_upsert_bf1e709.name: item_identifier

language_identifier_for_variants.description: Identifies the language by its internal ID (e.g., `d1f95fde-af02-b3b5-bd9e-f232311ccab8`) or codename (e.g., `codename/es-ES`).
language_identifier_for_variants.name: language_identifier

file_name.description:
Specifies the name of the uploaded binary file. The file name specified in the URL will be used for the asset name when you create an asset.

If the name of your file contains [reserved characters](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-2.2), you need to URL encode the file name first. For instance, use `my%20file%232.png` instead of `my file#2.png`. The file will then show as `my file#2.png` in the Kontent UI.
file_name.name: file_name

content_type_eb3978b.description: Specifies the [media type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types) of the binary data.
content_type_eb3978b.name: Content-type

content_length.description: Specifies the size of the binary file in bytes.
content_length.name: Content-length

asset_identifier.description: Identifies the asset by internal ID (e.g., `fcbb12e6-66a3-4672-85d9-d502d16b8d9c`) or external ID (e.g., `external-id/which-brewing-fits-you`).
asset_identifier.name: asset_identifier

asset_identifier_for_upsert.description:
Identifies an asset by its internal ID (e.g., `fcbb12e6-66a3-4672-85d9-d502d16b8d9c`) or external ID (e.g., `external-id/which-brewing-fits-you`). * When adding a new asset, use an external ID as the asset's identifier. * When updating an existing asset, identify the asset either by its internal ID or external ID.

New vs existing assets

If the specified external ID is not used by an existing asset, the API will create a new asset. For existing assets, the API updates only the specified asset's descriptions and title.
asset_identifier_for_upsert.name: asset_identifier

Reference.description: [Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) to a specific object in the project.

codename.description: The referenced object's codename. The value of the `codename` property must meet the conditions defined in [rules for codenames](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames).

external_id.description: The referenced object's [external ID](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9). The value of the `external_id` property must not contain the following characters: `/`, `.`, `;`.

codename.description: The content item's codename. Unless set while [creating the content item](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/add_a_content_item_e59ba3c), it is [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the item's `name` and can later be [modified](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/upsert_a_content_item_cc755ac).

sitemap_locations.description: The content item's location (or locations) in the project sitemap.

external_id.description:
The content item's external ID. The external ID can be used as a unique identifier to retrieve content from a different system.

External IDs cannot be upserted into existing items.

last_modified.description:
The [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) formatted date and time of the last change to the content item.

Workflows and values

Moving content items through workflow (either in UI or through the API) doesn't affect the last_modified value.

example.message: The provided request body is invalid. See the 'validation_errors' attribute for more information and specify a valid JSON object.

validation_errors.message: No patch operations were provided, provide at least one operation.

error_code.description: The specific internal code for the type of error. Only useful for finding patterns among error requests.

message.description: The error message explaining why the error occurred.

validation_errors.description: A list of specific issues that occurred when processing the request.

Pagination.description: Information about the next page of results.

continuation_token.description: Identifier of the next page of results. Is `null` when on the last page of results.

next_page.description: A URL to the next page of results. Is `null` when on the last page of results.

codename.description: The content item's codename. Unless set while [creating the content item](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/add_a_content_item_e59ba3c), it is [initially generated](#tag/References/rules-for-codenames) from the item's `name` and can later be [modified](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/upsert_a_content_item_cc755ac). When upserting an item without specifying its `codename`, the `codename` gets autogenerated based on the `name`'s value.

sitemap_locations.description: One or more references to sitemap locations.

external_id.description: The content item's external ID. The external ID can be used as a unique identifier to retrieve content from a different system.

AssetInVariant.description:
The value of asset elements is an array of [Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) objects. Each object represents a single asset, which can be referenced only once.

When retrieving asset elements, the Management API will always reference assets with their internal IDs.

When updating asset elements, you can reference assets by their internal ID or external ID.

CustomElementInVariant.description: When retrieving and updating custom elements, the format of the value will be identical for both GET and PUT operations.

DateTimeInVariant.description:
Time in this element is interpreted as [UTC](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coordinated_Universal_Time) and stored as an [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) formatted string.

When retrieving and updating date & time elements, the format of the value will be identical for both GET and PUT operations.

LinkedItemsInVariant.description:
The value of linked items elements is an array of [Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) objects. Each reference represents a single content item. Every content item can be referenced only once.

When retrieving linked items elements, the Management API will always reference content items with their internal IDs.

When updating linked items elements, you can reference a content item by its internal ID, codename, or external ID.

MultipleChoiceInVariant.description:
The value of *Multiple choice* elements is an array of [Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) objects. Each reference represents one of the unique multiple choice options.

If the element is configured as single option (i.e., Radio buttons), it must contain a reference to exactly one option. When configured as multiple option (i.e., Checkboxes), the element can contain references to as many options as are defined in the content type. In case no option is selected, the value of the element will be an empty array.

When retrieving *Multiple choice* elements, the Management API will always reference the multiple choice options with their internal IDs.

When updating *Multiple choice* elements, you can reference an option by its internal ID or codename.

NumberInVariant.description: When retrieving and updating number elements, the format of the value will be identical for both GET and PUT operations.

RichTextInVariant.description:
By default, if there is no text, the element's value is a single empty paragraph: `


`. The element's value can contain HTML formatted text, specific HTML elements, tags, and atrributes, and must form a valid HTML5 fragment.

Nesting HTML elements in rich text

At the top level, only the following elements are allowed: <p>, <h1>, <h2>, <h3>, <h4>, <ul>, <ol>, <table>, <object> (for content items and components), and <figure> (for images). These top-level elements can NOT be nested except for lists (<ul> and <ol>). Text is not allowed at the top level with the exception of new lines and white space characters.

The table <td> element can alternatively contain top level elements except for <table> and <object>.

The <p>, <h1>, <h2>, <h3>, <h4>, <li>, and <td> elements can contain text and the following inline elements: <a>, <code>, <em>, <strong>, <sub>, <sup>. These elements can also contain <br/> elements for specifying break lines. 

The <a>, <code>, <em>, and <strong> inline elements can be nested but they cannot cross one another. For example, it's not allowed to open the <em> element, then the <strong> element, and then close the <em> element. Lists can be nested as long as the nested list (<ul> or <ol>) is the last HTML element of the list item, for example, <ol><li>List item<ul><li>Nested list item</li></ul></li></ol>.

Learn more about allowed [HTML elements in rich text](#section/Rich-text-element) elements.
RichTextInVariant.example:
Medium roast

These exempt a stronger flavor than light roasts. The beans are still more matte than oily1.

Caffeine contents are decreased. Medium roasts lack the grainy taste of lighter roasts. You also get a more balanced flavor, aroma and acidity.

TaxonomyInVariant.description:
The value of *Taxonomy* elements is an array of [Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) objects. Each reference represents a taxonomy term of a specific taxonomy group. Every taxonomy term can be referenced only once.

When retrieving *Taxonomy* elements, the Management API will always reference taxonomy terms with their internal IDs.

When updating *Taxonomy* elements, you can reference taxonomy terms by their internal ID or codename.

TextInVariant.description: When retrieving and updating *Text*elements, the format of the value will be identical for both GET and PUT operations.

UrlSlugInVariant.description:
When retrieving and updating URL slug elements, the format of the value will be identical for both GET and PUT operations.

Automatic vs. manual mode

The URL slug element can function in two modes, automatic and manual. When creating language variants in automatic mode, the system automatically generates the element's value based on the text element of your choice.

If you modify the element's value directly (either in UI or via API), the element switches to the manual mode. In this mode, the element does not react to changes made to the dependent text element. Learn about creating SEO-friendly URLs in your projects.

LanguageVariant.description: Localized variant of a content item.

elements.description: List of elements as defined in the item's content type.

language.description:
[Reference](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/references_9d4e6e9) to the language of the variant.

The default language will always have the ID of 00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000.

last_modified.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) formatted date and time of the last change of content.

FileReference.description: Points to a specific binary file uploaded to your project.

type.description: The type of the file reference.

AssetDescription.description: An asset description defines a description of an asset for a single language.

description.description: Description of the asset for a single language.

file_name.description:
The file's name.

Determined by the file referenced in the `file_reference` property.

title.description: The asset's display name. The title can be specified when [adding assets](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/add_an_asset_a7cf801), [updating or upserting assets](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/upsert_an_asset_0982745). If not specified, the `title ` property is `null`.
title.example: Makes the asset easier to find when you need it

image_width.description:
The image's width in pixels. Is `null` if the file is not an image.

Determined by the file referenced in the `file_reference` property.

image_height.description:
The image's height in pixels. Is `null` if the file is not an image.

Determined by the file referenced in the `file_reference` property.

size.description:
The file's size in bytes.

Determined by the file referenced in the `file_reference` property.

type.description:
The file's [MIME type](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types).

Determined by the file referenced in the `file_reference` property.

descriptions.description: The asset's description for each active language.

example.description: The asset's alt text for the default language.

external_id.description: The asset's external ID. The external ID can be specified when [adding assets](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/add_an_asset_a7cf801) (POST `/assets`) or [upserting assets](https://docs.kontent.ai/link-to/upsert_an_asset_0982745) (PUT `/assets/external-id/<external_id>`). If not specified, the `external_id` property is not present.

last_modified.description: [ISO-8601](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) formatted date and time of the last change to the asset.

title.description: The title of the new asset. Use this parameter to better identify and filter your assets in the UI.

descriptions.description: Asset descriptions for each active language.

Project.description: The `project` object contains the project ID and display name.

name.description: The display name of the project.

environment.description: The environment of the specified project.

id.description: The ID of the given object.

name.description: The display name of the given object.

codename.description: The codename of the given object.

ElementIssue.description: For each issue found in a specific language variant or content type, the `issues` array will contain a content element issue with metadata about the content element and an array of validation messages describing the problem.

messages: Element 'Body copy' contains an image 'Screenshot.png' that doesn't match the set limits: maximum width = 1280px.

messages.description:
Validation messages for the content element.

Terminology in messages

A "content module" is a content item referenced in the Linked items or Rich text elements. See Linked content and components for more details.

ProjectReport.description: A project validity report contains a list of issues found in language variants of all content items. For example, the issues can indicate that certain content elements contain values that do not meet the limitations set by a content type.

messages: Element 'Related articles' contains a content module Colombia Carlos Imbachi of type Coffee that is not allowed in this context.
Element 'Meta description' should have at most 160 characters(s) but has 174 character(s).

variant_issues.description: Report of the problems found in the project's content.

items.description: The `variant_issues` attribute is an array of issues found in the content of the project. Each variant issue object contains information necessary to identify the language variant (content item and project language metadata) and lists the content elements.

issues.description: Information about issues found in specific content elements.

Bearer.description: This API uses OAuth 2.0 [bearer token](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc6750) (API key) to authorize requests. Requests with an incorrect or missing `Authorization` header will fail with an [error](#section/Errors).
